1.long: (I talk, chatter in classical Greek, but in NT a more dignified word) I speak, say.

1.brief: but, on the other hand, and
1.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

1.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
1.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
(a) a people, characteristically of God's chosen people, first the Jews, then the Christians, (b) sometimes, but rarely, the people, the crowd.

1.brief: I stand by, am urgent, befall one, impend
1.long: I stand by, am urgent, befall one (as of evil), am at hand, impend.

1.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
1.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
a priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.).

1.brief: a general, magistrate, captain of the temple
1.long: (a) a general or leader of the army, (b) a magistrate or governor, (c) captain of the temple.
a temple, either the whole building, or specifically the outer courts, open to worshippers.
a Sadducee, a member of the aristocratic party among the Jews, from whom the high-priests were almost invariably chosen.

2.long: (a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.

2.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse.

3.long: (a) I throw upon, cast over, (b) I place upon, (c) I lay, (d) intrans: I strike upon, rush.

4.long: a male human being; a man, husband.

5.brief: a scribe, town-clerk, man of learning
5.long: (a) in Jerusalem, a scribe, one learned in the Jewish Law, a religious teacher, (b) at Ephesus, the town-clerk, the secretary of the city, (c) a man of learning generally.
(Aramaic form), Jerusalem, the capital of Palestine: hence Judaism, and allegorically, Christendom, the Christian Church.

35.brief: but, on the other hand, and

35.brief: an untranslatable word that makes a statement contingent
35.long: an untranslatable word (under the circumstances, in that case, anyhow), the general effect of which is to make a statement contingent, which would otherwise be definite: it is thus regularly used with the subjunctive mood.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
